I think I have just the right recommendation for you! Have you considered "Super"? It's a quirky and imaginative superhero movie that explores what happens when a young boy decides to take matters into his own hands and become a real-life superhero. With a talented cast including Ellen Page, Kevin Bacon, and Rainn Wilson, it's a fun and entertaining ride that's sure to delight fans of the genre.

If you're not in the mood for something quite so lighthearted, "Blow Out" is also an excellent choice. It's a tense and suspenseful thriller starring John Travolta as a sound recordist who accidentally records evidence of murder, putting his life in danger. With Nancy Allen by his side, it's a gripping mystery that keeps you on the edge of your seat until the very end.

If you're looking for a film that's not too intense and has a great cast, I'd recommend "Scott Pilgrim vs. the World". It's an action-packed comedy with a talented young cast, including Michael Cera and Mary Elizabeth Winstead. The movie is a lot of fun, with a unique blend of music and humor.

If you're in the mood for something more serious, but still engaging, I'd suggest "Blue Valentine". It's a powerful drama that explores the complexities of relationships through a non-linear storytelling style. Michelle Williams and Ryan Gosling deliver outstanding performances.

I think I've got just the thing for you! Have you considered "Gunless"? It's a really unique take on the Western genre, with a great performance from Paul Gross as a rugged gunslinger trying to navigate a town that doesn't quite understand his ways. Plus, the film's Canadian setting and humor add an extra layer of charm.

If you're not feeling up for a full-on Western, I'd also recommend "Wild Target". It's a fun, lighthearted romp with some great comedic performances from Rupert Everett and Emily Blunt (well, she's not in it, but I'm sure you get the idea!). The hitman-meets-thief plot is engaging, and the film has a nice balance of action and humor.
